data.text:
I think we see "great non-English films" threads every now and then but a lot of them are dramas and festival fare stuff generally. I was wondering if any of you can show me the best, the funniest comedy films that are not in English!

I'll start with one I saw earlier this year:

Japanese: Welcome Back, Mr McDonald

Really funny comedy that's virtually a stageplay given how limited its locations are. It's about the very troubled production of a late night radio drama, where clashing egos and logic inconsistencies result in a wild ride of collaborative storytelling. Very amusing movie to watch late in the night.

Takashi Miike's Happiness of the Katakuris.

It's a Japanese comedy/musical about a family who start a bnb and have to deal with all their guests dying.

It's much funnier and more joyful than it sounds. I first saw it at a film festival and it probably took me half an hour after exiting the theater to stop grinning and chuckling.

Last I looked it was free on Tubi.

Have some French movies!

- Les Tontons Flingueurs (absolute classic starring Lino Ventura, a 1960s comedy about the French mob)

- Les Visiteurs (Jean Reno & Christian Clavier play a medieval lord and peasant respectively, who are transported to modern-day (90s) France, incredibly silly hijinx ensue. Got a 2001 English-language remake titled Just Visiting that was so awful it almost bankrupted the production company)

- Astérix & Obélix : Mission Cléopâtre (the best of all the live-action Astérix movies, stars a murderers row of legendary French comedic actors, but may be slightly inaccessible due to it being a pop-culture comedy with a lot of French references)

I think we see "great non-English films" threads every now and then but a lot of them are dramas and festival fare stuff generally. I was wondering if any of you can show me the best, the funniest comedy films that are not in English!

I'll start with one I saw earlier this year:

Japanese: Welcome Back, Mr McDonald

Really funny comedy that's virtually a stageplay given how limited its locations are. It's about the very troubled production of a late night radio drama, where clashing egos and logic inconsistencies result in a wild ride of collaborative storytelling. Very amusing movie to watch late in the night.

Hahahaha, this is what I thought to suggest when I saw the thread. Just an absolutely charming movie.

Survive Style 5+

Pure hilarious insanity, but this trailer doesn't really sell it as there's no context to anything shown:

View: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=LEH7nDkiPEk

Kikujiru

A favourite of mine about a young boy trying to cross Japan to find his mum and a washed up gangster accompanies him:

View: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=vCg6zJC-Ubo

Castaway on the Moon

A romantic comedy about loneliness. A man tries to kill himself by jumping off a bridge in the middle of the city but wakes up on shore a tiny island in the middle of the city river. Decides to live there.

View: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=061ZyqHhdCo

Fish Story

A crazy anthology film where a comet is about to destroy the earth but a song released decades ago by a washed up Japanese band might just save the world.

View: https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=WppQoL7OAbU

Have some Czech films!

Four Murders is Enough Darling.

A dying spy hides something in an average schmuck's apartment, and suddenly various agencies are killing each other trying to get it, and he keeps winding up being blamed for it, leading everyone to think he's a sexy man of action and danger.

View: https://youtu.be/y6FF9lOXlsY

The Mysterious Castle in the Carpathians.

A comedy/fantasy with people finding a mad scientist's castle and attempting to thwart his evil plans. Some really fantastic fantasy sets and gadgets in this.

South korean soldier, north korean soldier and a shot-down american pilot meet in a very remote little village in the mountains. It's part anti-war movie part comedy. Somehow it works.

Post office worker from the city is send to the countryside, where he barely understands the people, because of their dialect.

Treasure hunt for a sunken treasure, with a really idiotic but funny band of thieves, that don't know anything about boats or the sea.

Weird people living in a weird house within a weird scenario.

I haven't watched this in fifteen years, but I think it probably still holds up.

Slim Susie is a swedish hillbilly crime comedy about a guy returning from the big city to his small hometown located in the middle of nowhere to try to find his missing sister. It's somewhat akin to a Coen brothers film, and is both very funny and a tad bittersweet.

I don't know how available it is outside of Sweden, but I think it might be on Netflix. There will be some references that will be impossible to understand if you're not swedish, but for the most part it should be fine.

Tuva Novotny who plays Susie has a family with Alexander Skarsgård, and honestly I'm just a tiny bit jealous of him. She is amazing.

Juzo Itami is a great director to check out. Tampopo is his most famous but I think Supermarket Woman is my favourite.
